text:
="preserve">Terence Trent Howard (later Terence Trent D'Arby; born March 15, 1962) is an American singer-songwriter. He became famous with his first studio album, "Introducing the Hardline According to Terence Trent D'Arby" in 1987.
D'Arby had hit songs including "Dance Little Sister", "Sign Your Name" and the #1 hit "Wishing Well".
D'Arby was born in Manhattan, New York City.
